title: CVE6003 Design of Tall Buildings | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: The structural behaviour of tall building systems will be covered in this module, along with key issues and methods that can be used to design such structures.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
The structural behaviour of tall building systems will be covered in this module, along with key issues and methods that can be used to design such structures.

Effective from AY2025/26 Trimester 2 (January 2026), the Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering will be transiting to Graduate Certificate in Civil Engineering. For more details, please refer to the full notice
This module will explore the structural behaviour of tall building systems, covering the major concerns and techniques useful to design such structures.
Different stability system will be described. These will include commonly used structural types.
The lateral and vertical loading will be considered, including seismic, wind and gravity. Different techniques to estimate them will be taught.
The use of numerical software for the analysis of the system will be explored in detail. At the same time, some advanced design considerations, such as progressive collapse will be included.
Specific design criteria and techniques for steel, concrete, and composite members will be covered.
Civil Engineers, Site Engineers, Field Engineers, Project Engineers
Candidates should possess a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering
A range of commonly used stability systems will be considered, using both steel and concrete materials
Simplified design rules will be provided
Gravity, wind and earthquake loading will be considered
Hand calculations and, where appropriate, FEA analysis and experimental data will be used
Finite element analysis of tall buildings
Finite element software ETABS will be used to create models of tall buildings and provide the analysis data needed for the design of structural elements
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Before embarking on an academic career, Paolo spent five years with AECOM and Hyder Consulting participating in the design of a wide variety of buildings, including commercial and residential high rise structures. He was involved in all stages of the design and was generally responsible for the design of the stability systems and other members of the buildings. His research sponsored by the Defence Science and Technology Agency (DSTA) focused on the behavior of concrete under extreme loading. He holds an MEng and a PhD from Imperial College London.
Introduction to tall buildings design and architectural development of tall buildings
Calculate the wind load on a building Using wind tunnel data
Calculate the earthquake excitation of the building according to the provisions of Eurocode 8
Lateral load resisting systems for steel buildings
Perform simple calculations of the stability of a braced frame deflection
Lateral load resisting systems for concrete buildings
Calculate the stiffness of a concrete core and its likely elastic deflections for wind loads
Preliminary design of a composite floor and columns system
Gravity systems for tall buildings – Precast concrete
Preliminary design of a precast floor and walls system
Finite element modelling of building systems
Create a finite element model of a building
Estimation of building loading using Analysis software
Calculate the wind and seismic loads on a building using the Finite element software. Apply loading calculated by hand or other methods
Perform a preliminary analysis of a tall building using given loads
Consider the preliminary design from the tutorial in week 11 and perform the analysis again using advanced materials
Special Topics: Motion perception, Damping and performance based design
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$3,606.88
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering is designed to equip engineers with specialised technical and practical skills to help the industry address increasingly complex civil engineering problems in a creative and sustainable way.
What is the prerequisite knowledge for the course?
Students should be familiar with basic design rules from Eurocodes.
Is any software required for the software?
Any analysis software used will be provided as part of the course.
Readying SIT's Civil Engineering Graduates for the Future Workforce
SIT's lifelong learning division lays the foundation for Class of 2020 Civil Engineering graduates to attain their Professional Engineering qualification.
This module deep dives into the design of shallow and piled foundations, and how they minimise the risk of catastrophic failure and excessive settlement.
CVE6002 Design of Steel and Composite Structures
This module covers fundamental approaches to designing steel-concrete composite buildings in accordance with EC4.
TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.
This module covers structural stability, dynamic problems, and developing fundamental equations in civil engineering.
This is the second module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.
TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
